alert.note: Alert for Estill; Jackson; Laurel; Lee; Owsley; Pulaski; Rockcastle (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 12 at 12:44PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Laurel, northwestern Owsley, southwestern Estill, northern Pulaski, Jackson, Rockcastle and southern Lee Counties through 130 PM EST... At 1243 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Rockford to near Liberty. Movement was southwest at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Bummer around 1255 PM EST. Mount Vernon, Muellersville and Hummel around 100 PM EST. Other locations in the path of these storms include Gum Sulphur, Hiatt, Lake Linville, Renfro Valley, Ottowa, Indian Lakes Park, Maretburg, Spiro, Quail, Bromo, Wabp, Sand Springs, Bee Lick, Bandy, Willailla, Level Green, Woodstock, Science Hill, Bobtown, Dabney and Valley Oak. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Interstate 75 in east central Kentucky between mile markers 46 and 72. Kentucky Highway 80 in Laurel County between mile markers 1 and 3. Kentucky Highway 80 in Pulaski County near mile marker 17, and between mile markers 20 and 40. Louis B. Nunn Parkway MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 PM EST for south central, southeastern and east central Kentucky.

area.areaDesc: Estill; Jackson; Laurel; Lee; Owsley; Pulaski; Rockcastle
